name: Gail Dennis
text: Double H Freight is a wonderful company to work for. They treat you like family not a number. The drivers treat each other like family. We work hard to provide the best, the fastest and most reliable service possible.

name: Laura Roberson
text: Good place for a truck driver with CDL- A to work. Flat beds mainly  some oversized loads. Home nearly every werkend.

name: tanya goodwin
text: The experience here is.. they send you out with a book of how to strap,no orintation of any kind, even if you have no experience in strapping,no driving test, they send you to the tip of Florida and if you have something to tarp there but only have 1 tarp, (you had said something to management a week before),they send you to Lowes to pick one up in downtown Florida(west Palm Beach at that).. try turning a flatbed trailer in a lowes parking lot, let alone getting the thing in there with bumper to bumper traffic(3 lanes).. they also don't send you out with any extra oil or anything for the truck.. after all of that, they then want you to drive to fyffe al which is a 13 hr drive after loading and unloading that same day to be there in the morning.. guess what.. they want you to fudge on your paper logs.. no, they don't come out and say do it, but, it is understood. . if your a good driver and want to work for a good company, this is not where you want to be.. this is only one of the things..I'm not the driver, but, I got to see first hand..(4yrs experience). Not an irate driver, just want good drivers to be aware..

name: Fred Sullivan
text: Absolutely terrible. It’s amazing how there’s a huge difference from UPS, Amazon, USPS and then FedEx. Every package I gotten from FedEx has either been damaged, left out in the open when it’s raining, just soaked, or came days later then what it originally has said. But never had any issues with the other carriers. And from the looks of other reviews I’m not the only one having problems and should be a sign that this fedex needs to do something better because obviously it’s a continuous problem.

name: Allen Norris
text: I should have posted this long ago bit we live out in St Clair County and every single time we order something and it gets sent via FedEx it never arrives when it's supposed to. Not to mention that nothing has ever been delivered to our actual house on the first try. Thankfully most of the time boxes get delivered to one of our neighbors on either side of us so it's very easy to just grab the box from them. But there has been several times where boxes just magically never show. They go out for delivery and either stay out for delivery for a day or 2 and I eventually call and end up getting a replacement shipped out or end up showing as delivered but never actually show up to our house at all and I still have to get a replacement sent out. We'd be better off without FedEx as an option out here and only UPS, Amazon or USPS depending on what's being shipped.

name: Gary Clark
text: Pick up a signature package that could not be left a my house. They held it for me  a d it went well. Thank you FX.

name: R Collins
text: In east metro Birmingham, FedEx is by far the worst package delivery service. When our office was closed on the Monday after Easter, a driver left sensitive packages on the ground in front of our locked door! The drivers can't (or won't) follow instructions printed in bold on their company's envelopes. While Alabama was under a face mask order, two different FedEx drivers refused to mask up and barged barefaced into our patient waiting area. When the glass door is locked, they immediately pound on it with the side of a fist even though I'm in plain view. UPS and other local couriers are able to find courteous, competent drivers, but somehow this FedEx branch can't seem to manage it. I've given serious thought to asking permission to meet the FedEx plane at the airport in person, rather than rolling the dice to see whether this gang of misfits can deliver next time.

name: Carol Prince
text: Lately, FedEx has continuously delivered my packages to my neighbors house and posted delivery exceptions, saying my address is unknown. I lived at the same address for 20 years. The ground deliveries coming out of Trussville isn’t the best.

name: Taylor Simmons
text: I'm giving this review to Bethany who works in the office. She has been the BEST person I have dealt with. She stayed on the phone with me while tracking my packages and calling people to figure out what was going on.

name: Dianne Pyles
text: Package delivered on time with great customer service!

name: RED PILLED MIXED BREED
text: I bought a PlayStation 5 and one of their drives stole it and they haven't fired him. People dont use FedEx use ups or someone else just not FedEx

name: Joseph Ray
text: I ordered 4 tires from a place in Kentucky that were all shipped out together at the same time. When they reached Nashville, TN, they got split. Only two of them were delivered on time with the tracking telling me the other 2 would come the next day. Well, I only got one of the next 2 the following day. Then tracking told me the third day that delivery was pending with no delivery date. So after 4 calls and one telling me I could go pick it up, which was a lie, I was told it would be the next day. So I have waited all day for it to come only to find out after a call at 8pm that it never got on the truck and tracking said it would be Tuesday before it would come since it is the weekend. After I chewed the rep a new one she emailed management and told them to contact me personally and to ship it out ASAP Monday morning and if it couldn't be shipped before 10am that I would come pick it up

name: Bernice Kieffer
text: Mis delivered 2 of our packages in 10 days but after having a conversation with them they are going to try and fix the problem so we'll see how this goes

name: leo wong
text:
The amount of complaints about this particular delivery service is pretty lengthy:

- they failed to send the package to the address
- dozens of fake updates on their website stating it was loaded on the truck (it wasn't because I checked every day with the FedEx drivers for a week and it was never there)
- would not pick up their phone, not even from FedEx HQ. Either went straight to voicemail or hung up after being transferred.
- had to drive 1hr round trip to pick up my DAMAGED PACKAGE with 1k insurance and 400$ shipping fee nearly 2 weeks later amidst Covid
- had to file a claim for damages/delays and extremely poor, lazy, downright deceitful employees

After reading all the other reviews it is no surprise at all. How FedEx has even allowed this branch to be in operation for this long speaks volumes about how much they care about customer service.

name: Zak Kittle
text: Service will have you wait around all day and then send you a text at the end of the day telling you it will be tomorrow. I’ve sat here for 3 days waiting to sign for 1 package.

name: btgamble2249
text: The web site showed my package delivered to the front door of my house. The package was not at either of the 2 doors to my house. I filed a claim. THEN, as an afterthought, I check the mailbox at the base of my driveway on the street. YEP...you guessed it, it was jammed in the mailbox. The driver was too lazy to come up the driveway and deliver the package were he said he left it. Very poor service with Home Delivery from FEDEX.

name: Prophet Reginald Walton
text: I've been waiting on my package which is luggage first a trip I'm going on with my church this is the location that has my package and I need to know why is my package being held at this location with no one providing me with any information on what I paid for? All I need is a answer I don't need the run around I need to know where my package is this is unacceptable and I will be coming to check on my package.

name: Frank Wager
text: They Lied to me about trying to “deliver my package at 10:30pm when they didn’t even show up at all” not to mention that their automated answering services takes 30-45 minutes on hold to even talk to a real person. This is the worst carrier I have ever dealt with.

name: Felicia Godfrey
text: Contractors are unorganized and The actual Fedex company don't really cater to them

name: The Pig is Spotted
text: I wish I could select negative stars. I own a small business and am dependent on deliveries. This location refuses to deliver within the scheduled times and cannot locate drivers to find out information. They give you the runaround when you ask when your packages will be delivered.

name: Sherita Keller
text: Just hate everything about this service! First and last time it was cheaper for the provider to use Fedex but from now on it’s the other guys! And customer services knows the same thing you know!!  Absolutely NOTHING  small business make money cause we depend on you guys to deliver bad weather it was cold yesterday not snowing or anything else so 2 thumbs down for me!

name: Melanie Alexander
text: My package is lost somewhere in there and I had to call the support line to find that at. Meanwhile the online tracking stated the package was on the truck and in route. Makes me not want to buy anything that would be delivered by the terrible company.

name: Chris Brown
text: Certainly not the most cordial staff.  The package that was supposed to be shipped to my house never arrived.  Luckily, I looked at the tracking number from the company who shipped it or FedEx would have just sent my package I spent two months waiting for to be ready back to the other side of the country without contacting me since "no one was available to sign for the package."  They claimed to make three delivery attempts to my house, however one person I spoke to claimed they made five attempts. Hmmm.  The last of which was on the 25th, however, the cameras outside never saw a FedEx truck in my driveway.  They certainly didn't come to the door or they would have been heard.  Regardless, if you have the option, it's most likely in your best interest to avoid them.

name: Beth Clay
text:
If I could give this FedEx no star at all, I would. I have a perishable item that needs to be delivered on a Thursday, then I tracked my package, it said that it has a wrong  address when I have actually provided the correct address. Friday came and somebody said it will be delivered that day as soon as they can and when I checked online, there it showed it will be delivered Saturday! I spoke with a lady and said the driver couldnt find the address when you can easily see it in Google Maps. The lady also said the driver was rushing and decided to just bring back the package to their office so now they just want me to pick it up, when it was supposed to be a gift to be delivered just before the family goes out of town for the holiday. It is sooooo frustrating!
I read all other reviews and I guess we have the same experience of getting a runaround.

name: Monique Houle
text: If there was an option for no stars that’s what I would have chosen. My delivery went out every day for 9 days and returned to facility every evening. I finally went to Fed Ex facility and finally got my package. I had called many times and they would only say it’s out for delivery today. Not helpful. I also messaged them several times and not one was responded to. UPS if you happen to read this, thumbs up for your service. I will try and avoid any thing shipping via Fed Ex.

name: Connie White
text: FedEx has not been reliable during this holiday season.  Had to make 2 phone calls before I could find out information about my packages. I found out that the packages were sitting on a truck since 12/10. Representative Contessa was rude and when asked if I could speak to her supervisor, her response was she did not have one.  So I guess Contessa in Birmingham, AL owns the company.  Not a good representation of FedEx.  I do not recommend use of this company at all.

name: Alison Sanders
text: I ordered some items from a store, the only option was to send via FedEx. They have had it for 2 weeks and still not finished the shipping to me. Apparently they do not understand what shipping or delivery means. Wouldn't use them again if they were last ones to shop packages thru.

name: Chris McBride
text: I was sent a shipment of six packages on 12/4/19. They were scheduled to arrive 12/9/19. Two showed up on the 10th, one on the 11th. The other three did not arrive until the 17th, in the middle of the night. the final three packages were delivered after I had gone to bed (around 11:30 PM according to the tracking data), were not brought to my door or left on my porch, but instead left on my front lawn. I discovered them there the next morning when I left for work. Throughout the shipping window, the tracking information was incorrect, frequently telling me I would receive the packages on a certain day, only to have them not arrive. I spoke to several customer service reps and was given inaccurate information repeatedly. One rep admitted that FedEx knew the delivery notifications I received were incorrect, but allowed them to be sent, and left uncorrected, anyway. The customer service number has established a policy of refusing to transfer incoming calls (to management, claims office, or the facility where my package was supposedly being held) and would not record any complaint. Physical FedEx locations (shipping depots) no longer list their phone numbers, leaving no recourse for locating packages that have arrived locally and are waiting to be delivered. This has been the worst customer service experience I have ever dealt with.

name: Google ruined Youtube
text: They constantly deliver to my neighbor MY package with MY address and my neighbors are kind enough to let me know! Incompetent and lazy employees!

name: Efye Music (EFYE)
text: Great Business Definitely Great Job

name: Jamillah Williams
text: I have been given the run arounds about my package. The package said it would be delivered on Saturday. I called they said it could come up to 8 p.m. So I just stayed at work off the clock waiting. No package arrived. Then it changes to the package just arrived in the warehouse. I was informed to send to feeex location for pickup tried that now it’s saying package to large so they won’t do that. So I decided to put a hold on the package to pick it up myself since my job is closed on Monday. So I get up this morning and I received a text alert stating my package is out for delivery on a truck. After they guaranteed me that I would be able to pick it up @ the location. Now it’s a waiting game to see where the driver is with the package. I’m beyond upset with my whole experience with fedex

name: Daniel Bain
text: I wish you could give a less than 1 star review. My package wasn't actually put on the truck, even though the tracking stated otherwise, and now my package won't arrive until 2 days from the day it was supposed to arrive. Fred Smith should use some of those tax break billions to make sure FedEx's customers packages arrive on time.

name: johnnie shaneyfelt
text: These are the most incompetent people I’ve ever encountered. I can’t believe that FedEx would even allow this branch to exist if it operates at such minimal capacity. Every FedEx along the way did it’s job until the Birmingham FedEx got my package and it sat there for three weeks and I literally had to go pick it up myself

name: A B
text: If I could rate Fed Ex a ZERO I would. My package, a child’s Christmas gift has been “ out for delivery “ for four days and not delivered because of “weather conditions”.Oh it’s been so terrible In Birmingham this week. 50 to 60 degree days and some rain. I consider myself lied to.  Waited all day on Saturday because it was supposedly on the truck again.  No delivery. Now it’s Sunday. No one answers. 1-800 number says maybe the weather was bad in Birmingham and you are in Trussville. Come on now!  Doesn’t seem headquarters are monitoring these complaints.

name: Kyle “Necronomikyle” Dockery
text:
I only visited this location to guard the gate when it had quit working. Normally there wouldn't be a need for what I was doing and as such there were no accomodations.

Basically, just had to sit in my car and use the bathroom in the woods for 14ish hours.

name: Blake Helms
text:
Had a delivery attempt Friday while at work. Wasn't able to sign.

Service rep and tracking info said it would be delivered Saturday. Called that morning to see if i could come pick it up.

-9:00am I call Rep 1. He said it not to leave my house. Delivery expected 10-2.
-2:00pm not there so I call Rep 2: said it would be delivered by 2:45
-3:00pm still not so I call Rep 3: said sorry previous 2 reps were incorrect it has been sitting at the facility all day, but facility would call me soon
-3:30: Never get call back so I dial 4th Rep: told me I could pick it up, but that they close at 4:30
-4:00 I get to the facility and there is no one there to help me.

Told to check back in Tuesday....

From now on I will always choose an alternate service. FedEx, or at least this FedEx facility has given me an awful experience.

name: Jerron Simpson
text: 1-800-GOFEDEX is the worst customer service hotline known to man. They don’t have a clue about their own locations, services, and hours. I was told to pick up a package from this location only to find out the hours they gave me the wrong and pick up at this location isn’t available. Company needs to reevaluate the infrastructure and policies.

name: Josh Scott
text: This FedEx facility on 1401 Gadsden Highway is not 24 hours. Found this out the hard way. They are closed Sunday and Monday. Even the days they are open are not 24 hours. Idiot driver took my package here and it is 40 miles from my house! Still trying to figure out how to get my package...

name: Bryan R
text:
The driver ran over my damn yard and messed my grass up with a huge indention of his rear tires in my yard.  I have been at this location for over 6 years and nothing like this has ever occurred.  Must have been a new driver.  I'm furious!  Didn't even bother knocking to let me know he or she did it.  We were at home at time as well. Put a complaint into FedEx twice now getting updates. Waiting on response.  I will update review if this matter is taking care of with no delays.  I suppose the next step is to put a freaking gate up to keep all driver's off my yard/grass!  This is ridiculous I'm even having to go thru with this matter.  There was ample room to turn around without backing down irresponsibly into my yard and messing it up.

UPDATE: A FedEx supervisor came out and repaired my yard at a descent response time.  Very pleased with results.  Extremely nice the supervisor was.  Thankyou for all you did Stacey.

name: valencia paquette
text: Worst carrier ever! 3 pkgs have been on truck for delivery each day since Tuesday. Included business name for easy location reference. Both Tuesday & Wednesday "no attempt made" to deliver. I have called twice today, both times they 1st say not on truck then come back to say it will be delivered by 8PM. All have different tracking #'s. I asked where pkgs are, I'll go pick up...they don't know which truck, if all on same truck or where trucks are...They are ridiculous!!! I will not order online if the carrier is FedEx. Crazy thing is our business received a FedEx pkg yesterday. Worst ever carrier.

name: Rose Dryden
text: Our Fedex drivers NEVER read our address correctly!! How hard is it to read NE instead of NW? One letter of the alphabet! Why hire illiterate employees?!!!  It’s been 10 years of them delivering to the wrong address, us being the ones tracking it down, and then picking it up ourselves. I literally do a better job at getting my packages. I can’t express how much FEDEX SUCKS!!!!

name: Bettie
text: It ok nice people. Went picked up my package they were very busy and I needed my package.

name: Jeffrey Watkins
text: Horrible drivers. Never can figure out my address. I'm a few miles down the road from the hub. Always have to go pick up packages there after a few days of waiting on the company to tell them to hold it. Absolute bull blin.

name: Kevin Grogan
text: This is the absolutely the worse courier service on the planet. If its a Friday delivery they will change it to Monday at the last minute. Garbage truck drivers are more dependable...

name: Marv Howell
text: Worst customer service. Unable to locate package nor return a priority call back to trace.

name: Stephen Stack
text: This place is a joke, my package is 3 days late, first they its the wrong address, it's not, call fed ex, they confirm the address, had to walk them trough it step by step. They said they'll deliver next day, wasn't even on the truck for delivery. Call them again, they give me same bs, now its Sunday, and it's still not here! I can't believe this, no phone number to call! They never called me for directions, nothing. I can't believe a delivery company, can't use google maps.........

name: Caleb Tucker
text: Just got a call from my fedex driver stating he knocked down the cable line to my house. We struggled with fedex all week to try and get the package delivered and then I have to leave work to go see the cable laying on the ground at my house. Called the customer service manager and got sorry not sorry. Will never use fedex again.

name: Ishmael II
text: Eternally "Out for Delivery" Totally dependent on Google even when they know it's wrong! If Google displayed the wrong zip code, they couldn't find the Court House of Vulcan!

name: Nathan Rice
text: Recurring instance of packages not getting delivered or getting lost, majority of the time I have to drive to the facility to pick up any packages because of failed deliveries that do not even get attempted.

name: Aidan Rowland
text: Thanks for breaking my new guitar amp that was a thousand dollars. Keep the change you cheapskates.

name: Phoenix Roper
text: Just like Valencia I have had two packages held since Tuesday. FedEx claimed they'd be delivered Wednesday then Thursday then Friday and now it says Saturday. No delivery made for two days and the rest just say excepted. This is an absolutely horrible service and no one should ever use it. I want my packages.

name: Ursula Avery
text: Company sucks with deliveries. Received emails saying package was delivered but yet there was no door tags nor did anyone come to my door. I was home on all attempts they claimed to make. I called corporate office and still no results. Am very P.O. because what I ordered is for my 7yr old's Bday gift.

name: Joe Klein
text: I don't know about their delivery, but I do know I called the Hoover police and told them about  Fed Truck with Tag# 1X2638A racing around Bluff Park at high speeds, it is a residential neighborhood,  50mph is unacceptable,  hope he does run over anybody, tried to call FedEx No one answers

name: Matt James
text: Closes at 430. And does not deliver on Mondays. Worst company ever.

name: Joel Hamer
text: Not my first choice for shipping. Tracked a package coming to myself. Information was incorrect. Ended up going to two different Fed Ex locations to look for the package it said tried to deliver and wasn't home and finally found. Not impressed....

name: Louis “ig: Ceo_of_Low” Steverson
text: Always some type of BS with these guys!

name: TGI GUY
text: Worst experience ever driver lied about my package and they told me to sign for my package and still didn’t deliver my package.

name: Joe Rinehuls
text: No public access

name: Daniel Marshall
text: They’re terrible on delivering your package I went to weeks waiting for a package to be delivered to my home I told them that I would be there on specific days and on those days they did not ring the doorbell they did not knock at all they just left a note on my door and walked away as I was sitting in the living room and when I called them they said I had to wait until they delivered the package back to the store location so when I asked them when the package will be delivered to the store location they told me they’re not sure very unprofessional and if I could choose not to have my package delivered to FedEx I definitely would have chosen another company

name: K Allen
text: What a bad joke. I would not make someone use this service not even my worst enemy. User bewear...

name: Nicole Patton

text: Penske trucks are governed at 65mph...which is understandable. But the acceleration of the truck was horrible on the 26ft box truck we got. text:
I remember when JBK started this terminal. Three of us from the Savannah, Ga. terminal came to Theodore to keep the customers satisfied & the product rolling.I don't remember the name of the trucking company that we replaced, but some of the drivers stayed with JBK and others left.
Before that nice terminal building/shop was built across from the air separation plant ( Union Carbide)
and the tank plant, we operated out of the guard shack inside the plant. We didn't even have JBK equipment yet. We were using the other companies rigs!  After a short time Kelley equipment and drivers started showing up.
The land was cleared for your terminal and a trailer was put there for an office. But the ground had turned into a mud pit! We parked on the street and walked to the trailer to get dispatched. Couldn't pull a rig in there, you're stuck if you did.

name: Amanda Patrick
text: still waiting on my lawn mower to be delivered by this company. They called me on Monday, no fault of the driver, to let me know that when it was loaded they didn't put it on a pallet and the driver had no way to unload it, he stated he had reached out to the terminal with no response. Since, he didnt' want to mess up my lawn mower, he asked me if I could call the reschedule the delivery. When I called, I got a gentleman who said well who forgot to put a pallet under it, sir idk, I don't work for you guys. He said you don't have a man at home that can just take it off off the truck, I said no sir, don't know any man strong enough to unload a  zero turn lawn mower in a crate by himself. He goes and you don't have a fork lift, again no sir, don't have one of those lying around either. He goes well guess I don't have a choice but to bring it back in and put a pallet under it, this is just rediculous. I am sorry to be a bother, but it is now day two of it suppose to be delivered and I still have no lawn mower and no contact from this company. I had to pay freight and they wanted me to do the work to unload their mistake. I called the company and was advised that my lawn mower was sitting waiting to be re loaded, but they couldn't tell me when this might happen or when it would be delivered. I don't want a phone call from this company to just give me more excuses or ask me if I could that fork lift or hulk of a man to do their job. I just want my lawn mower and then I will make sure to NOT ever have to deal with this company again. Learn some customer service and don't get mad when you guys don't do your job.

name: Eden Snyder
text: For anyone considering calling this place for a tow, save your time and money and stay FAR away!! We have had not one, but TWO horrible experiences with this tow service. The first time, they left my 70 year old Father stranded in 90° weather for hours on end, we have AAA and they assigned Hank's to the tow job. They accepted the job and didn't call/notify/cancel the job to give my Dad the opportunity to get another company assigned to the job, they just left him stranded!!! Then, my husband called them last night and they accepted his request for a tow directly,no AAA,  he called them himself since they were close. They told him they would be there in no more than 45 minutes. 1 hour later, no word. He calls them back, they say they took another job and would get him as soon as they finished. 3 HOURS LATER, my husband is still stranded and calls them for the third time. They end up telling him he may be better off calling another company. God forbid what would have happened or how long my husband would have waited if leaving it up to them to follow up on a service they accepted to begin with. Y'all are clearly in the wrong business, and people can be seriously hurt or have personal things in their life that an be SEVERELY affected by your negligence and lack of consideration. Thank God they weren't on their way to work or something pressing that required a timely arrival. Lesson learned. I will be sure to let AAA know to never assign this business to my tow jobs again, and I would recommend the same to all of you, unless you want yourself and loved one's to be stuck out in the middle of the night with no help or in the blistering Alabama heat. Spread the word, Hank's is not a reliable service and should not be in the business they are!

name: Amanda Graham
text:
I used Road Runner moving as they were the only company that I found that would move my upright piano without charging an arm and a leg. The only real downside to using this company was their call center - it took me forever to finally get scheduled and confirmed, since if the phone rings for too long, the call gets forwarded to a call center in another state. That does me no good.
However, once confirmed, the movers were professional and on time, and their estimate for my move was spot on. They were also very fast and efficient. The only down side to the actual move was that they did not wrap the furniture before items were placed on the dolly. The items might have been wrapped once inside the truck, but that just made me nervous.
Overall, a very positive experience.

text:
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! Tell your family and friends as well. Here is my experience moving from Bham to ATL (you cannot make this stuff up). I have moved over 20 times and they are the worst movers I've ever used.
1) They brought the wrong sized truck so many items were left and had to be brought later. Some of which never came at all.
2) They significantly damaged a number of items including my grand piano. I spent $500 to fix the piano and they refused to reimburse me.

name: Chuck Burns
text:
Hired to work as a local driver, to park my truck in Mobile, and commute there from my home 20 miles away.

A couple years later, I get injured on the job, so how do they respond? By changing my work location. Now I'm expected to commute all the way to their main terminal 105 miles away from my home.

To top it off, they've got me, while wearing a huge sling on my arm (shoulder surgery), shoved into a corner of the drivers lounge, with a school desk shoved against a worn out sofa.

I either sit leaning forward, which causes my arm to rest on my leg, putting an awkward strain on the shoulder, or I lean back, and am unable to reach the desk. OR I sit on the edge of the sofa, actually under the desk, and work like that until it becomes painfully uncomfortable.

So. I'm driving, one handed, 200 miles a day, to sit in a hot drivers lounge, on an uncomfortable vinyl sofa for 8 hours a day.

Don't waste your time with these clowns.

name: Mr. Jim Business
text: Suit... the Osborn rejects, when Osborn got run out of town, these kids who worked there decided to open their new company. Put inside Rainbow Logistics, im sure they are hauling GH cheap freight. just another pop up trucking company in Northeast Alabama. Time will tell how long they will be around, their drivers have bad tires, trucks missing fairings, and damaged, poor recruiting efforts, lower pay packages for similar companies of their size in this area. There are several other options for companies in this area, i suggest you check them all out.

resp.text: Suit is not the old Osborn Company. We are completely separate and have never been Osborn. As far as being inside the Rainbow Logistics building would be because Suit purchased the property!  Kids do NOT own the company. It is owned by Owners that have more than 25 years of exp in the trucking industry. We have now been in business for almost 2 years and have been quite successful! The Company has grown at a rapid pace and intend upon continuing!! Suit does not operate from a load board. We have dedicated customer accounts. We offer 2015 - 2017 International Pro Stars, Freightliner, Peterbilt 579 and Kenworth T680. As you can see in the pictures above. Apparently you were not a driver for this Company or you would know a lot more than you list in this review. I certainly recommend checking Suit out!

resp.text: Dispatch is not under any obligation to answer the phone or respond to emails after a Driver has terminated their employment. text: I was supposed to receive a package on Friday October 30, 2020 they called and ask for directions and now it’s November 8, 2020 no package but get emails everyday saying it’s in transit and will be delivered the following day. Called customer service and you get a foreign that hangs up on you and I was not ugly at all. Why can’t FedEx do your job and deliver my package or just be honest. name: Steve Garnett
text:
I gave them a one only because I couldn’t give them a zero. I’m not sure how FedEx is in other areas but in our part of Alabama it is terrible. I ordered an item on Tuesday that I needed by the weekend and paid for two day express delivery. I needed this item for a business trip I was leaving for on Sunday. I received several text messages throughout the day on Friday that the item was on the truck for delivery and would be delivered by the end of day. When it had not arrived by 7:00 I tracked the package and it said delivery attempt was made but no one was home. That’s a lie because I was home all day and had the front door open. They never tried to deliver the item!!! Now it’s supposed to arrive on Monday which is too late. I even called and asked if they could have someone deliver it but they refused.

I hear these kind of complaints all the time about FedEx. UPS is superb!!! I have received MANY packages delivered by UPS and NEVER has one been late. If a company doesn’t ship by UPS I won’t order from them. I’m fed up with FedEx!!!

name: Justin McMahan

name: John Appleseed
text: Ordered a small package that was supposed to be delivered on Saturday. It didn't make it on time. No big deal I can wait an extra day. Monday Comes around and they claimed my address was incorrect. Okay I could have put it in wrong. Nope I called Monday told them it was correct and they said it would be delivered tomorrow. Tuesday, they say the same thing, it will be here tomorrow. Wednesday, It still hasn't been put out on delivery and I am told once again it will be here tomorrow. NOPE. Thursday it finally goes out on delivery and I'm waiting and waiting and the driver waits until 4pm, to claim the address is incorrect! AFTER I CALLED 5 TIMES TO MAKE SURE IT WAS CORRECT. As a customer all this shows me is that the drivers must be too lazy to do their job and would rather keep a package in limbo until a customer gets fed up and goes to pick it up at the depot. UPS finds me on time and more often than not they get here early.

name: Vakiera Taylor
text: This was my first time dealing with fedex. Never again. UPS is the best. My package was suppose to been here on a Wednesday,  it is now Sunday and I still haven’t received my package. On Thursday they claim it was delivered and that was not true and a signature was required. They claim their was a duplicate package and it should arrive on Friday. Never got it. Call them again, they said it will definitely be here on Saturday by 6 pm. FedEx never showed and I seen two fedex truck this pass weekend but no one tried to attempt to deliver my package. Horrible service and my patience is running thin.

Again I ask to speak to a manager I had to call the corporate my self. Then the manager said they will deliver it today still at 330 pm I have not got it yet. I am so over fedex. They are so terrible I dont even want to give them one star.

Even then, they couldn't tell me approximately when the truck would leave Kennesaw and when it would arrive in Montgomery so I could be there at the Depot first thing to get the package they were supposed to deliver 2 days previous. We have sent men millions of miles to the moon and back, on numerous occasions, with pinpoint timing, but this bunch of idiots can't tell me an approximate time that a truck will leave a Depot...Fedex, you need to start painting homes or digging ditches because parcel delivery is not the occupation for you....You guys really suck when it comes to delivering parcels and customer service in general and should be ashamed of yourselves as a company.

name: Andy Shane
text:
I had a breakdown in a motorhome, an onboard computer derated my new diesel pusher to a 5 mph crawl, just across the highway from McElroy's sprawling headquarters campus, school.

After parking alongside their training course, I called the main number and was suprised when a foreman, Hollywood, picked up the phone immediately, cheerfully replying that he'd seen me limp up their driveway.

Long story short, I got to meet him, the owner's son Cody, the office staff, over the next few days. I learned about the origins of this family firm, its success. Each morning, the slow-moving parade of students in spotless rigs passed my stricken bus -- we were waiting on a part -- and the process was reversed at nightfall, all with military precision.

I tried to pick their brains without being a pest, learned a lot about equipment maintenance, highway safety.

Warmest regards to this stellar outfit. If I ever pursued an encore career (I fly Boeing 777s for a major airline) behind the wheel, this company would be my first choice.

text:
Mr. Jeff Gordon is a liar who promised to get us our medical supplies on a Saturday. The supplies were delivered at 3:00am on a Thursday to the Huntsville location. They were loaded and promised to be delivered that Thursday. Didn’t happen. Then they were loaded and to be delivered on Friday. Didn’t happen. Our facility spoke with him and he promised to deliver our  medical supplies to us by 12:00 noon on Saturday. Didn’t happen.
Or course no one is able to assist us with our non delivery of medical supplies to a local nursing home.
Do not place anything of any importance in their care. They will not provide any information as to why it was loaded not once but twice and then not delivered. It seems to me that it would take more time to remove it and reload into a trailer then to empty the truck of deliveries.
Poor customer service and poor service to the city of Huntsville.

name: Trey McDowell
text:
I received a call from them on Thursday. They asked if the could set up a delivery day with me. I asked if there was any way they could deliver it Thursday because it is food for my Kennel.
She explained they couldn't and would deliver it to me the next day, Friday. She said that I had to be here to receive the freight. So I made arrangements and waited. I got a call that afternoon telling me she didn't know what happened that my freight didn't make it on the truck, would it be ok if they delivered it Monday. I stated again that this was food for animals and really needed it. She said she was sorry and would it be ok if it was delivered Monday. I stated that I guess I really didn't have a choice did I. She said not really.
So today (Monday) I waited and had not heard from them. So at 2:34 I called asking if it would be delivered. The woman told me it was on the truck and that the driver was at Lowe's down by be and that I was the next stop.
An hour and a half later I called back asking what was going on. She said that the driver isn't good about returning calls and that he had some other stops that he was doing before me.
At 5:02 I called and a different lady acting flabbergasted that I didn't get my order yet. She said she would call the driver but he was the worst at calling them back (sounds like they need new drivers in my opinion).
I told her that I have repeatedly stressed how important this delivery was and that I didn't understand what the problem was. She apologized and said she didn't know.
I then told her that if the delivery wasn't here today that they could send it back to the company and explain to them why it wasn't delivered, that they had already wasted two days of my time and they wouldn't waste another. She said she understood that she would be upset too.
I've received no calls from a manager or person trying to make this right. The driver never showed with my freight. This company acts like their customers don't matter. It is now 7:38 and obvious they aren't showing.
So.... use them at your own risk. Because time isn't of the essence to them and neither is your freight that you are shipping. Keep that in mind before you pay them for their service, because it is atrocious.

name: Nate
text:
I've gotten a few large items (150-200+ lbs) delivered from Southeastern Freight Lines, and their customer service has been horrible every time. I live on a cul-de-sac, and they ALWAYS call and ask me to meet them somewhere else for the delivery since they have a policy of no dead-end street deliveries. If I have to meet you somewhere other than the delivery address, you're not a delivery service! No other freight company that's delivered to my house has ever had a problem with it, including full size semi trucks.

They also often request that I help the driver unload the delivery from the back of the truck, because most of their delivery trucks aren't equipped with lift gates, or even a hand truck with a ratcheting platform. Either send another assistant, or make a policy of only lift gate trucks for residential deliveries! I understand it will cost extra, but that can be an up front charge on to the residential delivery service, rather than requesting the customer assist with the delivery.

Very unprofessional service every time I've dealt with them - go with someone else!

text: I've been driven 30yrs so I know the deafferents between a good company and a bad one. From the first day Wright Trans impressed me. And That's not easy. I requested an auto KW T680 and got it. Great truck. Good runs and all the miles you want. They let you run on your schedule. As long as the freight is getting moved, They don't care what schedule you keep. I meet both Wright brothers on the first day and better people you couldn't ask to work for. Professional and friendly. And my Dispatcher Karen? Best in the business. I'm totally happy work at this place.

She was very straight with me and did not try to put a apple in front of my face that I would never get to bite at some companies do. from the moment I walked through the front doors of Wright Transportation I literally felt right at home. My dispatcher Thelma has been great to work with and I see myself spending many more years with Wright transportation

name: Kent Merritt
text:
I've been employed by Wright for just over a year, and I love it here.  Staff is knowledgeable and friendly but professional. My real only complaint is the cost of health insurance. They keep me running at my place, and don't harp on me for running my pace. This is the single best employer I've ever worked for.  I honestly believe that I will retire from here.  This is a truly family company who cares about their drivers as long as you are safe and get your runs done in a timely manner.  Dash cameras face forward only, and don't record sound.  We just had an incident recently where a aggressive and dangerous driver cut off one of our trucks and brake checked our driver, causing an accident. The camera saved our driver and company from false and tax money wasting court time by fly by night lawyers.

No Transportation company is perfect, as the trade has gone far downhill due to government overregulation and overreach, and the ELD's shortening our work days, and the widespread unprofessionalism of super truckers and undertrained steering wheel holders. But, Wright is as good of a general carrier with dry vans that I have ever heard of. Yes, I  could get into specialized hauling and make more money, but Wright has done nothing for me to want to leave them.

name: turbojet powered
text: I am retired law enforcement and a military veteran.  I recently obtained my CDL Class A and applied for a drivers position at TWT.  I was informed that I was not eligible for employment due to having resigned from another trucking company.  This is all well and fine if anybody at TWT, including the safety manager, would have called me to get my side of the story....they certainly did not contact me.  My driving record is clean. I have no criminal history and my credit score is outstanding. I think their closed minded policy is a insult to Veterans everywhere.  I think everybody, including veterans, should at least have the opportunity to tell their side of the story before a decision is made. I feel sorry for the drivers at TWT that have an incident and are relying on the safety manager to back them up. Good luck.

text: Great place to work.the people that work here is why I stay

name: Eric Avery
text: I trained with this company almost four years ago and I'm still here. I came in this industry expecting to get some experience at the first company that would hire me and move on but I haven't because Decker has been a dream. I have a lot of family members who are truck drivers and their horror stories have convinced me I'll probably never leave. Top notch equipment plenty of miles, able to work you as hard as you'd like to. My dispatcher is amazing. I even, for a  period, did have a really bad dispatcher, but when he failed me to get me to where I needed to be I took it upon myself to fly myself there. And while I was on home time I asked for new dispatcher. And without even having to ask I was reimbursed fully for all of my travel and flying expenses and when I came back to work I had a brand new dispatcher. Unbelievably amazing (by the way that dispatcher no longer works at the company so no need to worry). I feel it's important to point out though to people that the inward facing driver camera can be deactivated after 90 days at the expense of a potential one cent per mile bonus. So it's on you if you do not want a driver facing camera. Sketchy drivers who jump companies every two or three months beware because they don't put up with shenanigans but good drivers will feel appreciated here.

Great company to do business with, all of the dispatchers are top notch and have never let me down. They always communicate promptly and professionally. Anytime I get to do business with Decker, I genuinely get excited because I know, that I have the best on it!!

name: Mary Smith
text: My husband got offered a job with this company. The recruiter promised him certain amount of money to be paid, that he wouldn't have to work but in a certain region, but when he got there he found out none of that was true. It rained one of the days they were supposed to be out there learning securement training so they didn't get to do it that day. For some reason, the application you fill out online isn't good  enough, you need to fill out a paper application when you get there. They didn't check background, MVR until the  end of orientation, so truly employment is not promised, even if you go through orientation. They didn't give any Hands-On training on Qualcomm, though ELDs are now required, and the only day they got to get up there and actively practice tarping was the day that they had to leave and get their truck. How can a company not properly train employees securement, yet threaten prison time if its done incorrectly? My husband spoke to drivers while he was up there and each one of them verified that they don't make the money that is Promised by the company. One had been waiting for a load for two days!  Some of the instructors don't represent the company very well, they cuss openly and are rude, and are very disorganized,however it might just be a poor company all around.

resp.text: Hi Mary, thanks for your feedback. We will look into these issues and address them accordingly.

name: David Jason
text:
Driver left an expensive piece of equipment in an alley just before a tropical storm came through.
When the driver arrived, workers on site told the driver he was in the wrong location and the shipper had made a mistake. When he called the store (not the recipient on the label) he was sent to another wrong location. Finally we realized he was still in the wrong location and told the driver. He then loaded up and left.

When everyone had gone to lunch he returned and without telling anyone he put the crates in the alley and left!

On the website, UPS indicates the shipment was signed for by someone who wasn't even there. No one signed for delivery but on the website it says it was signed for by someone who was 10 miles away at the time of delivery. This is a flat out lie, the signature line is blank.

Two days later the driver called for redelivery and he disputed these events.  I challenged his recollection of the facts and apparently upset him. We were then labelled a "hostile" recipient. My call with him was heated but profanity free and fact based.

We do  quite a bit of business with the package side of UPS. The driver has become a friend of ours over the years. However I'm not sure we can stay with them. Very disappointing!

name: Ryan Nielsen
text:
First off... The customer service agent was very agitated on the phone, even attempted to "speak down to me"... Anyway....
I had a crew on a jobsite to receive the originally scheduled delivery, which never showed(2/11)....I had to call to find out there was a weather delay.  Complete waste of time and money for me...  They changed the shipment to the next Tuesday(2/16).  I arranged to receive it Tuesday, but then they called Monday(2/15) to tell me it was delayed again.  At that point I simply asked if there was anyway to get it to the site Tuesday because I will have a crew there waiting for it, the customer service "lady" chuckled and asked how my crew was going to drive on ice....?  They are staying at hotel nearby, so they'd probably drive....?   I'd never recommend UPS Freight to anyone after this.. I can understand weather delays...but the tone to which I was being spoken to was completely unnecessary and honestly offensive.  She even spoke off the phone during the call to people in the warehouse asking "Any of you working tomorrow?"  Seriously?  Is this UPS or Jimbo's Hauling Service?  At this point I'd bet Jimbo is better at his job anyway.

UPS Freight "We know more than you and don't care about your time, we ain't working tomorrow"

name: Debby Fischer
text: I used G an G Auto to ship my car from Sacramento to  the Trenton TX area. I paid their deposit of $150 after they first quoted $100 and quoted first $800 then $850 to do the job. My son signed the contract and then the issues started. They were supposed to pick up my car on March 26, 2021 so it could get to Trenton Tx by end of March. They never called and I had to call them. Told me the driver is running late will call in the AM of March 27, 2021. Never called and no pick up. This repeated for 2 days. No one ever called back and I always had to chase them. Finally, a supervisor called back told me they driver was AWOL, the guy John who I was dealing with was fired and now they have to find a new driver,  like that was my fault. Took them days to get back to me after I spoke to another supervisor who said she would call back and guess what… no call back. Finally, they said the had a new driver and it would cost $1400 with $150 already paid so I would have to pay the driver $1250. After my son already signed a contract for $850. When I asked for a discount for my trouble and extra cost to rent my rental car for another week they told me no. I do not know how this company has such a high rating with the BBB when they obviously extorted $400 dollars from me to get my car to Trenton TX and another $700 for the extra week of my car rental. Not to mention they never called back and were dishonest from the beginning. This company is horrible. Find a different company and do not  trust rating from the BBB.

resp.text: We apologize about this please provide me an order # since i checked and we do not have an order under Debby Fischer.

Great personal service at a great price.  My personal thanks to the lovely Maria for seeing this through, because she was  there for me day and night.  So sweet, professional and helpful.  Thanks G&G Auto Transport, especially to Maria.

resp.text: Thank you for your business.

name: justin parsons
text: ***BEWARE*** DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY.  I scheduled a pickup for 7/31 to deliver my new vehicle from FL to NC.  Adam Gomez gave me a price of $600 and said my vehicle would be picked up and possibly delivered on 7/31but delivery would be no later than 8/1.  I called Adam at 8:30 AM on 7/31 to confirm pickup.  He said he would call me back in a hour or two.  At 1:30 PM, the car lot I purchased the vehicle from calls me.  They said they have here heard from G&G.  I called Adam and he told me they do not have a driver yet.  I told him that this was poor communication and he needed to call me back with a scheduled time for pickup.  At 6 PM I call G&G back and speak with someone different who says they still do not have a driver for my vehicle.  At 8 PM I receive a text from Adam saying they have a truck for $900 that can pick my vehicle up Sunday.  This is two days later than my original quote I and $300 more.  If you do not want your time wasted, use another company.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Justin I'm sorry to hear about your bad experience with our company, We're normally known for our exceptional attention to detail, and we regret that we missed the mark. Covid-19 has drastically changed the industry; prices are changing constantly, driver are staying home, there are looting and rioting all over the states etc. If you don't mind giving me a call at (256) 464-2554 at your earliest convenience, it would be greatly appreciated. We look forward to speaking with you and working toward earning back your business.

name: Doug Devine
text: Fed Ex in Evergreen, AL delivers our packages days after we are supposed to receive them.  They are often times damaged.  Have provided a gate code to main facility and to each driver to deliver on the day we are closed but they never use it so we don’t get the package that day.  What is worse, we never get it the next day either!  We get it two days later on a Thursday.  This is separate from the general late deliveries I spoke of above.  Also, Kennesaw, GA seems to be a black hole where once accepted, a package will take a minimum of three days to depart their facility.  Combine that with the delays from Evergreen and it’s completely ridiculous and unacceptable!  If given a choice I would not use Fed Ex for anything.

name: Zahra Ahmed
text: I ordered an item from Amazon and Estes was used as its carrier. I ordered on March 21st and since March 25th the system stated that it was shipped. When I contacted the seller, I was informed to contact Estes since that's the carrier. Estes stated that the shipment is still on its way to the Birmingham site. My package arrived at this site at 6A.M. on April 6th. The seller already informed me that I have to schedule a delivery with this location once mynitems has arrived. Since April 6th through April 8th, I was informed by the receptionist that my package is still on their truck and it wont get delivered the date it was supposed to arrive which was April 8th. I was informed that they use a 3rd party to deliver to residential. So the Birmingham site was negligent to time sensitive items. I was informed that I would receive my items a week later. Mind you, this site is only 25 minutes away from my home. I was advised by the receptionist that I can come to their site to pick up my package. That would require me to get a Uhaul, pay that out of my pocket and get someone to unload the Uhaul. Which I find this to be unprofessional and unjust. Luckily, the seller understood what being reliable means and provided me the fundings to get a Uhaul to get my shipment from this site. Going forward, if I ever order anything from any site and it requires Birmingham Estes to deliver it to me then I will cancel and order from somewhere else. They have no sense of how professionalism, time sensitive and customer service looks like. They definitely need a different organization skills within this location.

resp.text: Zahra, thank you for your feedback and we apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused. The freight transportation industry continues to experience unprecedented capacity challenges, as freight is impacted by a number of contributing factors, such as the continuing COVID-19 pandemic, driver shortages at an all-time high, the seasonal spring uptick in freight shipping, and the stimulus package resulting in higher purchase volumes. Thank you again for your feedback, we value your input.

Sad.

text: This particular FedEx distribution center consistently fails to deliver on time. I've had multiple missed deliveries in the past two months from this distribution center. FedEx does well from the distributions centers that are closer to me. However, this one is terrible. I have no idea why they are sending out home delivery trucks from a center so far away. I suggest anyone that orders a package from a vendor that uses FedEx, contact the vendor and tell them to order FedEx not to use Eastaboga for delivery.

Terrible company. Impossible to speak to a human when calling.
This is the third complaint I’ve had to make. I will never use fedex again if I can help it.

name: Tunya Parker
text: My package was reported as delivered on 12/22 at 12:15 pm. It says that it was left at my front door. I was at home and NO package was delivered to my house. It was not left in my driveway nor was it left at a neighbor's house. When I try to call FedEx all I get is a regurgitation of what I see online. They will not transfer me to a supervisor nor will they give a direct number for the Eastaboga center. They tell me that it was delivered (which it clearly was not) and then they tell me to contact the company that shipped the pkg. The company that shipped it verified the address and told me that I would have to contact FedEx again. After being transferred from the computer system, to a person, and back to the computer again over MULTIPLE calls for 2 days I have realized that I will probably never get my pkg and that FedEx is completely incompetent. Why lie about delivering a pkg?? If you lost it just say so.

How do I get my merchants to use only UPS? They have never lost a package. They must use GPS. Next stop, BBB

Where is there Corporate people. They must not take their responsibilities serious.

name: Nathan Bishop
text: Place is a joke, didn’t check I.d for my signature required package, gave it to one of my neighbors. Everyone of position of authority I talked to acted as if though this was nothing to give my merchandise to complete strangers instead of verifying like every courier service in America. Took multiple calls only for the man to further insult me by asking a military veteran to not to physically attack his driver like we are some mindless ape...are you serious right now?!? Further complaints have been filed you guys really need to do some house cleaning out there and get some competent personnel in there that understand their job and take pride in doing it, not passing the buck to someone else because you lack the fortitude and professionalism to do your job. This could have very well been someone’s ashes or a family heirloom in that box that they simply do not care in properly delivering. Keep that in mind when you intend to use this place.
